subject.geographic: Red River, 30 Miles below Alexandria, La

mods.abstract: Committed to Jail. WAS COMMITTED to the Jail of this Parish on Frieday the 22d inst., a negro woman named ANNA, and says she bleongs to Wm. Grimes, living on Red River, about thirty miles below the town of Alexandria. Description:--The said woman is of black complexion, about 19 years of age and about 5 feet 5 inches high. Now therefore the owner of the said slave is requested to come forward, prove property, pay charges and take her away or she will be dealt with according to law. S.D. MAGEE. Jailor. mar23-tf.
mods.note: Louisiana State University Libraries, Special Collections ( http://www.lib.lsu.edu/special )
mods.accessCondition: E-mail lsudiglib@lsu.edu with questions or comments about the collection.

Physical rights are retained by the LSU Libraries. Copyright has expired and the item is therefore in the public domain. Permission to reproduce this image must be requested through the Special Collections Department, Louisiana State University Libraries.
mods.note: Louisiana Runaway Slave Advertisements, 1836-1865, Louisiana Digital Library, Baton Rouge, La.
